entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 4.14.25
entry.summary: Live from near Lakeview, U.S. Senator Jeff Merkley talks about tariffs, a drop in tourism to the U.S., his priorities for this spring, and other topics.

entry.title: Roseburg Set for Hottest Day of 2025 So Far
entry.summary: Roseburg is expected to hit 83°F on Monday, making it the hottest day of 2025 so far. That’s nearly 20 degrees above normal for April. The previous high this year was 78°F. While not a record, it’s close - the hottest April 14th on record was 88°F, set back in 1947

entry.title: MONDAY FORECAST TO BE HOTTEST DAY OF 2025 SO FAR
entry.summary: April 14, 2025 3:50 a.m. Monday is forecast to be the hottest day of 2025 so far in Roseburg. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the high is expected to be 83 degrees at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The normal high temperatures for this...

entry.title: ROSEBURG CITY COUNCIL WITH EARLY START FOR INTERVIEWS
entry.summary: April 14, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Roseburg City Council will have an early start to its meeting on Monday night. At 6:30 p.m. councilors will interview two applicants for the vacant Ward 1 Position 1 seat. Jason Tate and John Houston have both applied to the position recently vacated due to the resignation of former...

entry.title: REEDSPORT WITH CITY COUNCIL VACANCY
entry.summary: April 14, 2025 3:20 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: The City of Reedsport is accepting applications to fill council position #5. Councilor Rich Patten recently resigned. The person selected will begin at the time of appointment and serve until the end of 2026. At the general election in November 2026, the position will be open...

entry.title: FRIDAY DEADLINE TO ENTER ARBOR DAY PHOTO CONTEST

entry.title: NORTH CREEK TRAIL REOPENS AT SOUTH SLOUGH RESERVE
entry.summary: April 14, 2025 2:50 a.m. The popular North Creek Trail at the South Slough Reserve near Charleston has reopened to the public, as of Friday. Public Involvement Coordinator Deborah Rudd said earlier a large tree had fallen between bridges 7 and 8, causing significant damage to the trail. Rudd said the impact uprooted a large...

entry.title: TRANSIENT JAILED FOLLOWING LATE NIGHT ROCK THROWING SPREE
entry.summary: April 21, 2025 9;30 a.m. A transient was jailed following a late-night rock throwing spree on Friday. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at 11:00 p.m. several callers reported that windows on their homes were being damaged by an unknown man throwing rocks. entry.title: GRANTS PASS AREA MAN MISSING SINCE APRIL 6TH
entry.summary: April 12, 2025 7:00 a.m. (Man has been located safe as of Saturday morning) A Grants Pass area man is missing, and the Josephine County Sheriff’s Office is seeking help from the public. 33-year-old Roy Osbourne Damrill left his home outside Grants Pass on Sunday, April 6th. Damrill is known to frequent the mountains for...

entry.title: MISSING ROSEBURG MAN FOUND DECEASED AFTER MOTORCYCLE ACCIDENT
entry.summary: April 11, 2025 2:00 p.m. A Roseburg man last seen Wednesday afternoon was found deceased Thursday afternoon as a result of a motorcycle accident. A search effort had been initiated after he was reported missing. Undersheriff Brad O’Dell of the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office said 63-year-old Terry Kruh hadn’t been seen since 5:00 p.m. when...

entry.title: ROSEBURG HAD SECOND DAY WITH HIGH AROUND 10 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL
entry.summary: April 11, 2025 5:50 a.m. Roseburg had a second day in a row with a high temperature around ten degrees above normal. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said the mercury reached 73 degrees on Thursday afternoon at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The normal high temperature for April 10th is 62 degrees. The...

A county release said the proclamation acknowledges that child abuse and neglect are serious issues impacting every part of the...

entry.title: ONLINE ENROLLMENT OPENS APRIL 14TH FOR ROSEBURG SCHOOL DISTRICT
entry.summary: April 11, 2025 3:20 a.m. Families are invited to begin enrolling their children in the Roseburg School District for the 2025-26 school year, starting April 14th. Online enrollment is required for all new, returning and re-enrolling students. A comprehensive guide to the process, including necessary documents and parent portal links is available on the districts...

entry.title: 60TH ANNIVERSARY GLIDE WILDFLOWER SHOW HAPPENING APRIL 26TH/27TH
entry.summary: April 11, 2025 3:05 a.m. The Glide Wildflower Show is having its 60th anniversary event later this month. Founded in 1965, it is the largest display of native flora in the northwest. Over 600 species of flowers, shrubs, grasses, ferns, lichens and mosses are gathered by dozens of volunteers who travel throughout southwest Oregon from...

entry.title: NORTH CREEK TRAIL TEMPORARILY CLOSED DUE TO SAFETY CONCERNS
entry.summary: April 11, 2025 2:50 a.m. The North Creek Trail at South Slough Reserve near Charleston is temporarily closed to public access until further notice.
